item.title: Morphological Structure and Reproduction of Marchantia
item.description:
Morphological Structure and Reproduction of Marchantia

Marchantia is a genus of liverworts known for its unique morphological features and reproductive strategies. These non-vascular plants are essential components of many ecosystems, often found in damp, shaded environments.

1. Morphological Structure of Marchantia

a. Thallus Structure

  • Thallus: The primary body of Marchantia is flat, lobed, and green, resembling a leaf-like structure. It is typically about 1-2 mm thick and can grow several centimeters in diameter.
